item.title: Five of us were going around Bruxelles the last week, for OFFDEM and server-setup happenings mostly ... and almost none had mobile data and rather relied on random WIFIs .... personally testing our own app's "offline-first" approach and features for real :) The server-setup workshops generally went very well and some attendees now aim to give sessions themselves in Strasbourg and other places -- and next one is at LAG in Amsterdam this friday ... https://delta.chat/en/2023-01-27-upcoming-mail-server-workshops

Wondering what the best e-mail server is out there? How about rolling one for your friends and communities? Here is a new setup guide for "automatic accounts" e-mail servers --- and an announcement of upcoming hands-on workshops in Brussels, Amsterdam, Montpellier and Gent ... all in the next 8 weeks! https://delta.chat/en/2023-01-27-upcoming-mail-server-workshops

If you want to gift all Delta Chat users something you may boost or forward https://delta.chat/en/2022-12-15-uidevjob to somebody who might be interested to help with Android/iOS or other developments. We wish you all some good last days of this year! A cute painted greek delta in a with green twigs, some xmas balls and presents

Decentralization Unchained -- diverse backgrounds of Delta Chat developments that you probably didn't know about ... https://delta.chat/en/2022-12-15-uidevjob -- note that our twitter presence is fading further, has shifted to the fediverse for more than a year already #leavingtwitter

Decentralization Unchained -- here is a lot of background what's happening with Delta Chat, serving as background for our job offers to experienced UI devs https://delta.chat/en/2022-12-15-uidevjob #fossjobs #deltachat
Some of our users report that missing an attachment happens more rarely with delta chat üòâ
Before scheduling a meeting, ask yourself ....

thanks to @adbenitez (maintainer of that mastodon bot) for pointing out that OAUTH2 is available too -- so no need to provide your password to the bot. Of course it still sees you interacting which still requires some trust to be put into the operator of the bot.

This @delta account is mediated in a chat group where anyone in the group can reply and see interactions, or follow the "home" chat with posts from the accounts we follow. For implementation see https://github.com/simplebot-org/simplebot_mastodon (also on PyPI) -- the bot needs your credentials so it's best to run this bot in an environment you trust.

If you are curious or interested about bot development then the echo bot repository has example impls in Python, Rust, Javascript/Typescript and even C (but better to use Rust these days ;) https://github.com/deltachat-bot/echo -- and thanks to @adbenitez there are also many more advanced chat bots written as "simplebot" plugins here https://github.com/simplebot-org

Wouldn't it be nice if you could migrate with Delta Chat from one e-mail provider to another and keep all your chats and communications and encryption working seamlessly? With 1.32 Delta Chat releases we added initial support towards this goal on all platforms ü•≥ "Introducing Automatic E-Mail Address Porting (AEAP)". https://delta.chat/en/2022-09-14-aeap

A little tech preview for Delta Chat iOS to easily setup a second device, under the hood using the fast evolving Rust implementation of @IPFS@twitter.com https://github.com/n0-computer/iroh/ -- not the only use we are envisioning of this interesting P2P effort ;)

Some days ago we visited the fine folks behind https://mailcow.email and https://servercow.de -- while mailcow installations already work well with Delta Chat we want to increase speed of message delivery, spam processing and aim for easier onboarding with mailcow installs.
OH "Russia is about as federated as Telegram"

Big chance that the new EU messenger interop mandates, if they work out at all, will break e2e-encryption. Better and easier it would be to mandate that large platforms allow third party apps to access their (existing!) APIs to send/receive messages. CC @Klaus_Mueller@twitter.com

RT @ThierryBreton@twitter.com For the 1st time ever, the European Commission will become the #supervisor of ‚Äúgatekeepers‚Äù and very large platforms & online search engines. Here is a sneak preview of how the #DSA & #DMA enforcement will be organised üîú https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/sneak-peek-how-commission-enforce-dsa-dma-thierry-breton/?published=t üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/ThierryBreton/status/1544274269424820224

Thanks for the recognition of https://webxdc.org ! Truth be told, we are just beginning to explore the new possibilities of chat-shared web apps :) RT @christophtill@twitter.com Ich halte die Integration von WebXDC in @delta_chat@twitter.com f√ºr einen echten Gamechanger. Das macht den Messenger so flexibel wie keinen zweiten. Der Messenger ist so quasi unendlich und leicht in seinen Funktionen erweiterbar. Hammer Technik! üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/christophtill/status/1544800060382367753

https://webxdc.org apps radically cut out advertising because tracking and targeting is impossible. As an app developer you can not get at user-data at all because all dataflows between user's devices, app data is only shared in the chat between peers, e2e-encrypted.
Oh, and these 500 added lines include quite a number of automated tests as well.

Through these ~500 added lines of Rust code, all Delta Chat apps will grow the ability to seamlessly port their e-mail address from one provider to another. The code's relative simplicity was hard-earned through many prior discusssions https://github.com/deltachat/deltachat-core-rust/pull/3385/files
